briefTitle: Cryotherapy vs. Cryocompression for Preventing Chemotherapy-induced-peripheral-neuropathy in Women Undergoing Chemotherapy
officialTitle: CROPSI Study A Randomized, Observer-blinded Clinical Trial Evaluating Effectiveness of Cryotherapy vs. Cryocompression for Preventing CIPN in Women Undergoing Chemotherapy
conditions: Chemotherapy-induced Peripheral Neuropathy, Chemotherapeutic Toxicity, Chemotherapeutic Agent Toxicity
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients with breast cancer or other gynecological tumors
* planned neoadjuvant, adjuvant or palliative chemotherapy
* \</= two lines chemotherapy as pre-therapy (adjuvant chemotherapy counts as one line)
* at least three cycles of chemotherapy with taxanes
* written consent
* 18 years and older

Exclusion Criteria:

* PNP \>/= 2
* neuralgia
* metastases in bones, metastases in soft tissue (located in skin, hands or feet)
* Raynaud syndrome
* peripheral arterial ischemia
* hand-feet syndrome
